skill.name: when-creating-skill-template-use-skill-builder
skill.description: Create new Claude Code Skills with proper YAML frontmatter, progressive disclosure structure, and complete directory organization
skill.summary: Create new Claude Code Skills with proper YAML frontmatter, progressive disclosure structure, and complete directory organization
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: All static security findings are false positives. The skill is a documentation template generator. Detected patterns are markdown code blocks, YAML frontmatter, and documentation examples - not executable code with security implications.

content.value_statement: Creating Claude Code skills from scratch requires consistent structure, YAML metadata, and documentation. This skill automates template generation with best practices so you can focus on implementation.
actual_capabilities: Generates complete skill directory structure with SKILL.md, README.md, PROCESS.md, and process-diagram.gv
Creates valid YAML frontmatter with all required metadata fields
Implements progressive disclosure with 5-phase workflow (Design, Generate, Implement, Test, Document)
Produces GraphViz process diagrams for visual workflow representation
Adds memory patterns and hooks integration for skill state management
Includes validation criteria and success metrics for each phase
limitations: Requires claude-flow@alpha dependency for skill execution
Does not execute generated skills - only creates templates
Does not validate external dependencies or prerequisites
Best for utilities, development, testing, and machine-learning categories

best_practices: Use the when-creating-skill-template-use-skill-builder skill at the start of any new skill project to ensure consistent structure from the beginning
Follow the 5-phase workflow (Design, Generate, Implement, Test, Document) for comprehensive skill development
Include specific validation criteria for each phase to ensure skills meet quality standards before deployment
Leverage the generated memory patterns to maintain session state and data continuity across skill phases
anti_patterns: Manually creating skill files without using the template generator - leads to inconsistent structure and missing metadata
Skipping the documentation phase - makes skills difficult for others to understand and use
Omitting validation criteria - results in skills that pass initial testing but fail in production scenarios
Ignoring the YAML frontmatter requirements - causes skills to fail validation and integration checks

faq.question: What files does this skill generate?
faq.answer: The skill generates four files: SKILL.md (main specification with YAML frontmatter and phase details), README.md (quick start guide), PROCESS.md (detailed workflow documentation), and process-diagram.gv (GraphViz visualization of the process).

faq.question: Do I need any dependencies to use generated skills?
faq.answer: Generated skills require claude-flow@alpha as a dependency. This is automatically included in the YAML frontmatter templates. Ensure your environment has this package installed.

faq.question: Can I customize the number of phases in the generated template?
faq.answer: The default template includes 5 phases (Design, Generate, Implement, Test, Document). You can modify the phase structure in the generated SKILL.md file to match your specific requirements.

faq.question: What naming convention should I follow for skill names?
faq.answer: Skills should follow the pattern 'when-[condition]-use-[skill-name]'. For example: 'when-parsing-json-use-json-helper' or 'when-testing-api-use-automated-tester'.

faq.question: How does the memory pattern system work?
faq.answer: Generated skills include a memory schema that stores session data, phase results, and completion status. This enables skills to maintain state across multiple interactions and recover from interruptions.

faq.question: Can I integrate generated skills with other Claude Code skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Generated skills support integration patterns with other skills through the cascade system and can be chained in workflows. The SKILL.md template includes integration examples for SPARC and cascade patterns.
